channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Don Lemon and Georgia Fort vow to continue reporting following arrests tied to anti-ICE protest
item.description: The two independent journalists face federal charges related to the interruption of a church service in Minnesota earlier this month. Lemon and Fort say they were there to cover a protest.
item.content:encoded:
The two independent journalists face federal charges related to the interruption of a church service in Minnesota earlier this month. Lemon and Fort say they were there to cover a protest.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: 'Sanford and Son' co-star Demond Wilson dies at 79
item.description: The actor was best known for playing Lamont Sanford, opposite Redd Foxx's Fred Sanford in the hit 1970s sitcom. Wilson died Friday from complications related to cancer, his publicist said.
item.content:encoded:
The actor was best known for playing Lamont Sanford, opposite Redd Foxx's Fred Sanford in the hit 1970s sitcom. Wilson died Friday from complications related to cancer, his publicist said.

(Image credit: NBC Television)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Milan protesters call for U.S. ICE agents to leave Italy as Winter Games approach
item.description: An ICE unit from the US Department of Homeland Security is playing a role providing security at the Winter Games. At past Olympics, their involvement would have been unremarkable. But after the violence in Minneapolis, many Italians protesting in Milan say ICE agents are no longer welcome.
item.content:encoded:
An ICE unit from the US Department of Homeland Security is playing a role providing security at the Winter Games. At past Olympics, their involvement would have been unremarkable. But after the violence in Minneapolis, many Italians protesting in Milan say ICE agents are no longer welcome.

(Image credit: PIERO CRUCIATTI)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Judge says she won't halt the immigration enforcement surge as a lawsuit proceeds
item.description: U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi praised the ruling on social media, calling it "another HUGE" legal win for the Justice Department.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi praised the ruling on social media, calling it "another HUGE" legal win for the Justice Department.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina defeats No. 1 Aryana Sabalenka to win Australian Open
item.description: Saturday's win marks the second Grand Slam title for Rybakina, who took Wimbledon in 2022.
item.content:encoded:
Saturday's win marks the second Grand Slam title for Rybakina, who took Wimbledon in 2022.

(Image credit: Aaron Favila)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The U.S. will likely lose its measles elimination status. Here's what that means
item.description: The South Carolina measles outbreak is now bigger than last year's Texas outbreak and is happening as the U.S. is poised to lose its measles elimination status.
item.content:encoded:
The South Carolina measles outbreak is now bigger than last year's Texas outbreak and is happening as the U.S. is poised to lose its measles elimination status.

(Image credit: Annie Rice)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 23 Palestinians as Gaza ceasefire inches forward
item.description: Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 23 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting.
item.content:encoded:
Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 23 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: With decades-long restrictions lifted, a Pakistani brewery has started exporting beer
item.description: Drinking is illegal for Pakistan's Muslim majority, but Murree Brewery's beer has long been available to non-Muslims and foreigners there. Now it's being exported to the U.K., Japan and Portugal. Is the U.S. next?
item.content:encoded:
Drinking is illegal for Pakistan's Muslim majority, but Murree Brewery's beer has long been available to non-Muslims and foreigners there. Now it's being exported to the U.K., Japan and Portugal. Is the U.S. next?

(Image credit: Betsy Joles for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: A red hat, inspired by a symbol of resistance to Nazi occupation, gains traction in Minnesota
item.description: A Minneapolis knitting shop has resurrected the design of a Norwegian cap worn to protest Nazi occupation. Its owner says the money raised from hat pattern sales will support the local immigrant community.
item.content:encoded:
A Minneapolis knitting shop has resurrected the design of a Norwegian cap worn to protest Nazi occupation. Its owner says the money raised from hat pattern sales will support the local immigrant community.

(Image credit: Gilah Mashaal)
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: Want to get stronger? Start with these 6 muscle-building exercises
item.description: If you're curious about starting a resistance training routine and not sure where to begin, start with these expert-recommended movements.
item.content:encoded: If you're curious about starting a resistance training routine and not sure where to begin, start with these expert-recommended movements.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone
